snippet: Pontiac, Mich., once a healthy blue-collar city, has been guided by emergency managers for the last four years.
abstract: Pontiac, Mich, once a healthy blue-collar city, has been guided by emergency managers since 2009; some say city's sprint toward solvency by privatizing services is attracting new businesses, improving services and saving it, but critics consider notion of outside manager anti-democratic.

byline.contributor: Monica Davey contributed reporting from Chicago.

lead_paragraph: Pontiac, Mich., once a healthy blue-collar city, has been guided by emergency managers for the last four years.

headline.seo: Lessons for Detroit in Pontiac’s Years of Emergency Oversight
headline.main: Lessons for Detroit in a City’s Takeover
headline.print_headline: Lessons for Detroit in a City’s Takeover
